caption: DHCP Activity
description: DHCP Activity events report MAC to IP assignment via DHCP from a client or server.
name: dhcp_activity

activity.description: The normalized caption of 'activity_id' or the source specific value.

5.caption: Ack
5.description: DHCPACK: The server accepts the request by sending the client a DHCP Acknowledgment message.

7.caption: Release
7.description: DHCPRELEASE: A DHCP client sends a DHCPRELEASE packet to the server to release the IP address and cancel any remaining lease.

app_name.description: The name of the application that initiated the DHCP connection.

category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

4004.caption: DHCP Activity
4004.description: DHCP Activity events report MAC to IP assignment via DHCP from a client or server.

cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

connection_info.description: The connection information relevant to the network traffic.

dst_endpoint.description: The responder (server) of the DHCP connection.

is_renewal.description: Indicates whether this is a lease/session renewal event.

lease_dur.description: This represents the length of the DHCP lease in seconds. This is present in DHCP Ack events.

src_endpoint.description: The initiator (client) of the DHCP connection.

traffic.description: The traffic details relevant to the network traffic.

transaction_uid.description: The unique identifier of the transaction. This is typically a random number generated from the client to associate a dhcp request/response pair.

type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

400400.caption: Unknown
400400.description: The activity type "DHCP Activity: Unknown" is not further specified.

400405.caption: DHCP Ack
400405.description: DHCPACK: The server accepts the request by sending the client a DHCP Acknowledgment message.

400407.caption: DHCP Release
400407.description: DHCPRELEASE: A DHCP client sends a DHCPRELEASE packet to the server to release the IP address and cancel any remaining lease.

400499.caption: Other
400499.description: The activity type "DHCP Activity: Other" is not further specified.
